Layout

Grid


[row]
  [column sm="6"] ... [/column]
  [column sm="6"] ... [/column]
[/row]
Basic example

The container component is also supported in case your theme doesn't include a container.


[container]
  [row]
    [column xs="6"] ... [/column]
    [column xs="6"] ... [/column]
  [/row]
[/container]
Basic example with container

The container-fluid component is supported as a discrete shortcode.


[container-fluid]  
[row]
    [column xs="6"] ... [/column]
    [column xs="6"] ... [/column]
  [/row]
[/container-fluid]
Basic example with fluid container

[container] parameters

Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

[row] parameters

Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

[column] parameters

Parameter Description Required Values Default
xs Size of column on extra small screens. 0 1-12, flex
sm Size of column on small screens. 0 1-12, flex
md Size of column on medium screens. 0 1-12, flex
lg Size of column on large screens. 0 1-12, flex
xl Size of column on extra large screens. 0 1-12, flex
offset_xs Offset on extra small screens. 0 0-12
offset_sm Offset on small screens. 0 0-12
offset_md Offset on medium screens. 0 0-12
offset_lg Offset on large screens. 0 0-12
offset_xl Offset on extra large screens. 0 0-12
pull_xs Pull on extra small screens. 0 0-12
pull_sm Pull on small screens. 0 0-12
pull_md Pull on medium screens. 0 0-12
pull_lg Pull on large screens. 0 0-12
pull_xl Pull on extra large screens. 0 0-12
push_xs Push on extra small screens. 0 0-12
push_sm Push on small screens. 0 0-12
push_md Push on medium screens. 0 0-12
push_lg Push on large screens. 0 0-12
push_xl Push on extra large screens. 0 0-12
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

Media Object


[media]
  [media-object]
    <img src="placeholder-path/placeholder.png">
  [/media-object]
  [media-body]
    [media-heading] <h4>Media Heading</h4> [/media-heading]
    ...
  [/media-body]
[/media]
Basic example

Wrap several [media-object]s in [media-list], useful for comment threads or articles lists.


[media-list]
  [media]
    [media-object]
      <img src="placeholder-path/placeholder.png">
    [/media-object]
    [media-body]
      [media-heading] <h4>Media Heading</h4> [/media-heading]
      ...
    [/media-body]
  [/media]
  [media]
    [media-object]
      <img src="placeholder-path/placeholder.png">
    [/media-object]
    [media-body]
      [media-heading] <h4>Media Heading</h4> [/media-heading]
      ...
    [/media-body]
  [/media]
[/media-list]
Media List

[media] parameters

Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

[media-object] parameters

Parameter Description Required Values Default
media Whether the image pulls to the left or right. 0 left, right left
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

[media-body] parameters

Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

[media-heading] parameters

Note: [media-heading] should contain heading tag (h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, or h6), inserted using the WordPress editor. If a header tag is not added h4 will be inserted automatically.
Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

Responsive Utilities


[hidden down="sm"] ... [/hidden]
Basic example

[hidden] parameters

Parameter Description Required Values Default
up Hide the contents on this screen size and above. 0 xs, sm, md, lg, xl
down Hide the contents on this screen size and below. 0 xs, sm, md, lg, xl
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

Components

Alerts

Any links, headings, or strong or bold text within an alert will automatically be styled to match the alert type.


[alert type="success"] ... [/alert]
Basic example

[alert] parameters

Note: Any links, headings, or strong or bold text within an alert will automatically be styled to match the alert type.
Parameter Description Required Values Default
type The type of the alert. 0 success, info, warning, danger success
dismissible If the alert should be dismissable. 0 ðŸš© (flag)
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

Breadcrumb

Remember that [breadcrumb] must wrap a set of links inserted via the WordPress editor.


[breadcrumb]
  <a href="#link1"> Link 1 </a>
  <a href="#link2"> Link 2 </a>
  [active] Link 3 [/active]
[/breadcrumb]
Basic example

[breadcrumb] parameters

Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

Buttons

Wrap any a, button, or input tag inserted via the WordPress editor in [button] to give it button properties and classes.

Wrap any a, button, or input tag inserted via the WordPress editor in [button] to give it button properties and classes.


[button type="primary"] <a href="#link">Button Text</a> [/button]
Basic example

Set button sizes with the size parameter.


[button type="primary" size="lg"] <a href="#link">Button Text</a> [/button]
Large button

Set block flag for block-style buttons.


[button type="primary" block] <a href="#link">Button Text</a> [/button]
Button-block example

[button] parameters

Note: Wrap any a, button, or input tag inserted via the WordPress editor in [button] to give it button properties and classes.
Parameter Description Required Values Default
type The type of the button. 0 primary, secondary, success, info, warning, danger, link, outline-primary, outline-secondary, outline-success, outline-info, outline-warning, outline-danger primary
size The size of the button. 0 sm, lg
block Flag whether the button should be a block-level button. 0 ðŸš© (flag)
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

Button Groups

Remember that [button] must wrap an a, button, or input tag inserted via the WordPress editor.

Remember that [button] must wrap an a, button, or input tag inserted via the WordPress editor.


[button-group]
  [button type="secondary"] [active]<a href="#link">Text</a>[/active] [/button]
  [button type="secondary"] <a href="#link">Text</a> [/button]
  [button type="secondary"] <a href="#link">Text</a> [/button]
[/button-group]
Basic example

Set the vertical flag to make the buttons appear vertically stacked rather than horiztonally.


[button-group vertical]
  [button type="secondary"] [active]<a href="#link">Text</a>[/active] [/button]
  [button type="secondary"] <a href="#link">Text</a> [/button]
  [button type="secondary"] <a href="#link">Text</a> [/button]
[/button-group]
Vertical example

Wrap [button group]s in [button-toolbar] to make a button toolbar.


[button-toolbar]
  [button-group]
    [button type="secondary"] [active]<a href="#link">Text</a>[/active] [/button]
    [button type="secondary"] <a href="#link">Text</a> [/button]
    [button type="secondary"] <a href="#link">Text</a> [/button]
  [/button-group]
  [button-group]
    [button type="secondary"] <a href="#link">Text</a> [/button]
    [button type="secondary"] <a href="#link">Text</a> [/button]
    [button type="secondary"] <a href="#link">Text</a> [/button]
  [/button-group]
  [button-group]
    [button type="secondary"] [disabled]<a href="#link">Text</a>[/disabled] [/button]
  [/button-group]
[/button-toolbar]
Button Toolbar

[button-group] parameters

Note: Remember that [button] must wrap an a, button, or input tag inserted via the WordPress editor.
Parameter Description Required Values Default
size The size of the button. 0 sm, lg
vertical Flag whether the button is vertical. 0 ðŸš© (flag)
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

[button-toolbar] parameters

Note: Remember that [button] must wrap an a, button, or input tag inserted via the WordPress editor.
Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

Cards


[card]
  [card-block]
    [card-title] <h4>Card Title</h4> [/card-title]
    [card-subtitle] <h6>Card Subtitle</h6> [/card-subtitle]
    ...
  [/card-block]
[/card]
Basic example

Image caps are supported with the [card-img] shortcode and the top or bottom flag.


[card]
  [card-img top]
    <img src="placeholder-path/placeholder-lg.png" class="img-fluid">
  [/card-img]
  [card-block]
    [card-title] <h4>Card Title</h4> [/card-title]
    ...
  [/card-block]
[/card]
Card with image cap

Image overlay cards are supported with the [card-img-overlay] shortcode.


[card]
  [card-img]
    <img src="placeholder-path/placeholder-lg.png" class="img-fluid">
  [/card-img]
  [card-img-overlay]
    [card-title] <h4>Card Title</h4> [/card-title]
    ...
  [/card-img-overlay]
[/card]
Card with image overlay

Card header and card footers are supported with the [card-header] and [card-footer] shortcodes.


[card]
  [card-header] ... [/card-header]
  [card-block]
    [card-title] <h4>Card Title</h4> [/card-title]
    ...
  [/card-block]
  [card-footer] ... [/card-footer]
[/card]
Card with Header and Footer

[card] parameters

Parameter Description Required Values Default
type Contextual background color for the card. 0 primary, secondary, success, info, warning, danger, link, outline-primary, outline-secondary, outline-success, outline-info, outline-warning, outline-danger primary
inverse Flag whether to invert the text color for contextual backgrounds. 0 ðŸš© (flag)
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

[card-block] parameters

Note: Any p or blockquote tags within [card-block] will automatically receive card-text or card-blockquote classes respectively
Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

[card-title] parameters

Note: [card-title] should contain a heading tag (h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, or h6), inserted using the WordPress editor. If a heading tag is not added h4 will be inserted automatically
Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

[card-subtitle] parameters

Note: [card-subtitle] should contain a heading tag (h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, or h6), inserted using the WordPress editor. If a heading tag is not added h6 will be inserted automatically
Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

[card-img] parameters

Note: [card-img] should contain an image inserted using the WordPress editor.
Parameter Description Required Values Default
top Flag whether this image cap is at the top of the card. 0 ðŸš© (flag)
bottom Flag whether this image cap is at the bottom of the card. 0 ðŸš© (flag)
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

[card-img-overlay] parameters

Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

[card-header] parameters

Note: [card-header] should contain a heading tag (h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, or h6), inserted using the WordPress editor. If a heading tag is not added div (no heading) will be inserted automatically
Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

[card-footer] parameters

Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

Carousel

Remember that [carousel] must wrap a set of images inserted via the WordPress editor.


[carousel]
  <img src="placeholder-path/placeholder-lg.png">
  <img src="placeholder-path/placeholder-lg.png">
  <img src="placeholder-path/placeholder-lg.png">
[/carousel]
Basic example

[carousel] parameters

Note: Remember that [carousel] must wrap a set of images inserted via the WordPress editor.
Parameter Description Required Values Default
interval The amount of time to delay between automatically cycling an item. If false, carousel will not automatically cycle. 0 any number (in ms) or "false" 5000
pause Whether the carousel pauses on hover. If set to null, hovering over the carousel won't pause it. 0 hover, null hover
wrap Whether the carousel should cycle continuously or have hard stops. 0 true, false true
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

Collapse

Create an accordion by wrapping [card]s in [accordion].


[accordion]
  [card]
    [card-header] ... [/card-header]
    [card-block]
      ...
    [/card-block]
  [/card]
  [card]
    [card-header] ... [/card-header]
    [card-block]
      ...
    [/card-block]
  [/card]
[/accordion]
Accordion example

[accordion] parameters

Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

Dropdowns

Remember that [dropdown-menu] must wrap an a, or button tags inserted via the WordPress editor.

The dropdown flag must be used on a [button] shortcode for dropdowns to work.


[dropdown]
  [button dropdown]Dropdown Button[/button]
  [dropdown-menu]
    <a href="#link">Link 1</a>
    <a href="#link">Link 2</a>
    <a href="#link">Link 3</a>
  [/dropdown-menu]
[/dropdown]
Basic example

Add a header to label sections of actions in any dropdown menu.


[dropdown]
  [button dropdown]Dropdown Button[/button]
  [dropdown-menu]
    <h6>Dropdown header</h6>
    <a href="#link">Link 1</a>
    <a href="#link">Link 2</a>
    <a href="#link">Link 3</a>
  [/dropdown-menu]
[/dropdown]
Dropdown with header tags as labels

Separate groups of related menu items with a [dropdown-divider].


[dropdown]
  [button dropdown]Dropdown Button[/button]
  [dropdown-menu]
    <a href="#link">Link 1</a>
    [dropdown-divider]
    <a href="#link">Link 2</a>
    <a href="#link">Link 3</a>
  [/dropdown-menu]
[/dropdown]
Divider example

[dropdown] parameters

Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

[dropdown-menu] parameters

Parameter Description Required Values Default
align Alignment of the dropdown menu. 0 right
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

[dropdown-divider] parameters

Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

Jumbotron


[jumbotron]
  <h1> Hello, World! </h1>
  [lead] This is a simple hero unit, a simple jumbotron-style component for calling extra attention to featured content or information. [/lead]
[/jumbotron]
Basic example

Set the fluid flag to make a fluid jumbotron.


[jumbotron fluid]
  <h1> Hello, World! </h1>
  [lead] This is a simple hero unit, a simple jumbotron-style component for calling extra attention to featured content or information. [/lead]
[/jumbotron]
Fluid example

[jumbotron] parameters

Parameter Description Required Values Default
fluid Flag whether jumbotron should be fluid. 0 ðŸš© (flag)
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

List Group

Remember that [list-group] must wrap a set of links or list items inserted via the WordPress editor.


[list-group]
  <ul>
    <li>Cras justo odio</li>
    <li>Dapibus ac facilisis in</li>
    <li>Morbi leo risus</li>
    <li>Porta ac consectetur ac</li>
    <li>Vestibulum at eros</li>
  </ul>
[/list-group]
Basic example

Create a linked list by wrapping links


[list-group]
  <a href="#link1">Cras justo odio</a>
  [active]<a href="#link2">Dapibus ac facilisis in</a>[/active]
  <a href="#link3">Morbi leo risus</a>
  <a href="#link4">Porta ac consectetur ac</a>
  [disabled]<a href="#link5">Vestibulum at eros</a>[/disabled]
[/list-group]
Linked list

Wrap items in the list-item shortcode to give them contextual styles


[list-group]
  [list-item type="success"]<a href="#link1">Cras justo odio</a>[/list-item]
  [list-item type="info"]<a href="#link2">Dapibus ac facilisis in</a>[/list-item]
  [list-item type="warning"]<a href="#link3">Morbi leo risus</a>[/list-item]
  [list-item type="danger"]<a href="#link4">Porta ac consectetur ac</a>[/list-item]
[/list-group]
Contextual styles

[list-group] parameters

Note: Remember that [list-group] must wrap a set of links or list items inserted via the WordPress editor.
Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

[list-item] parameters

Note: Remember that [list-group] must wrap a set of links or list items inserted via the WordPress editor.
Parameter Description Required Values Default
type The type of the list-item. 0 success, info, warning, danger success
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

Navs

Remember that [nav] must wrap a set of links and list items inserted via the WordPress editor.


[nav]
  <ul>
    <li><a href="#link1">Cras justo odio</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link2">Dapibus ac facilisis in</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link3">Morbi leo risus</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link4">Porta ac consectetur ac</a></li>
  </ul>
[/nav]
Basic example

Set the inline flag to make an inline nav.


[nav inline]
  <ul>
    <li><a href="#link1">Cras justo odio</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link2">Dapibus ac facilisis in</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link3">Morbi leo risus</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link4">Porta ac consectetur ac</a></li>
  </ul>
[/nav]
Inline example

Set the tabs flag to make an tab-styled nav.


[nav tabs]
  <ul>
    <li><a href="#link1">Cras justo odio</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link2">Dapibus ac facilisis in</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link3">Morbi leo risus</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link4">Porta ac consectetur ac</a></li>
  </ul>
[/nav]
Tabs example

Set the pills flag to make an pills-styled nav.


[nav pills]
  <ul>
    <li><a href="#link1">Cras justo odio</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link2">Dapibus ac facilisis in</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link3">Morbi leo risus</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link4">Porta ac consectetur ac</a></li>
  </ul>
[/nav]
Pills example

Pills-styled navs can also be stacked with the stacked flag.


[nav pills stacked]
  <ul>
    <li><a href="#link1">Cras justo odio</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link2">Dapibus ac facilisis in</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link3">Morbi leo risus</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link4">Porta ac consectetur ac</a></li>
  </ul>
[/nav]
Stacked pills example

[nav] parameters

Note: Remember that [nav] must wrap a set of links and list items inserted via the WordPress editor.
Parameter Description Required Values Default
inline Flag whether nav should be inline. 0 ðŸš© (flag)
tabs Flag whether nav should be styled as tabs. 0 ðŸš© (flag)
pills Flag whether nav should be styled as pills. 0 ðŸš© (flag)
stacked Flag whether nav should be stacked. 0 ðŸš© (flag)
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text

Pagination

Remember that [pagination] must wrap a set of list items and links inserted via the WordPress editor.


[pagination]
  <ul>
    <li><a href="#link1">Cras justo odio</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link2">Dapibus ac facilisis in</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link3">Morbi leo risus</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link4">Porta ac consectetur ac</a></li>
  </ul>
[/pagination]
Basic example 

[pagination size="lg"]
  <ul>
    <li><a href="#link1">Cras justo odio</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link2">Dapibus ac facilisis in</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link3">Morbi leo risus</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link4">Porta ac consectetur ac</a></li>
  </ul>
[/pagination]
Large example 

[pagination size="sm"]
  <ul>
    <li><a href="#link1">Cras justo odio</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link2">Dapibus ac facilisis in</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link3">Morbi leo risus</a></li>
    <li><a href="#link4">Porta ac consectetur ac</a></li>
  </ul>
[/pagination]
Small example 

[pagination]
  <ul>
    <li>[active]<a href="#link1">Cras justo odio</a>[/active]</li>
    <li><a href="#link2">Dapibus ac facilisis in</a></li>
    <li>[disabled]<a href="#link3">Morbi leo risus</a>[/disabled]</li>
    <li><a href="#link4">Porta ac consectetur ac</a></li>
  </ul>
[/pagination]
Active and disabled states

[pagination] parameters

Note: Remember that [pagination] must wrap a set of list items and links inserted via the WordPress editor.
Parameter Description Required Values Default
class Any extra classes you want to add. optional any text
data Data attribute and value pairs separated by a comma. Pairs separated by pipe. optional any text
